citations.narrative:
The facility does not have a written contingency plan. The contingency plan allows the facility to be prepared in the event
of an emergency or disaster, thus helping to safeguard the good health and well-being of the animals in these situations.
The licensee must develop, document and follow an appropriate contingency plan.
Correct by July 30, 2023

The applicant doesn't have an exercise plan for the dogs. Failure to have an exercise plan and have it reviewed by the
attending veterinarian approve the exercise plan does not ensure that the exercise received by the dogs is appropriate
and their health and well-being may suffer.
Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise and the
plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian. The applicant must have the attending veterinarian review and
approve the exercise plan in order to support the health and well-being of the dogs.
Correct by July 30, 2023

The facility does not have a written Program of Veterinary Care. Failure to have a written Program of Veterinary Care
does not ensure the animals are receiving appropriate and adequate veterinary care which could have a negative impact
on their health and well-being. A sampling of parasites and other pests is not being taken in accordance with a schedule
from the attending veterinarian. A complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog is not being conducted in a
12 month period by the attending veterinarian.
Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is documented in writing and signed by
the attending veterinarian. The applicant must develop a written program of veterinary care that is signed by the attending
veterinarian in order to ensure the health and well-being of the dogs.
Correct by July 30, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.134(a) 
   
Contingency planning. 
The facility does not have a written contingency plan. The contingency plan allows the facility to be prepared in the event 
of an emergency or disaster, thus helping to safeguard the good health and well-being of the animals in these situations. 
The licensee must develop, document and follow an appropriate contingency plan. 
 
Correct by July 30, 2023 
3.8 
   
Exercise for dogs. 
The applicant doesn't have an exercise plan for the dogs. Failure to have an exercise plan and have it reviewed by the 
attending veterinarian approve the exercise plan does not ensure that the exercise received by the dogs is appropriate 
and their health and well-being may suffer. 
 
Dealers must develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide dogs with the opportunity for exercise and the 
plan must be approved by the attending veterinarian. The applicant must have the attending veterinarian review and 
approve the exercise plan in order to support the health and well-being of the dogs. 
 
Correct by July 30, 2023 
3.13(a) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility does not have a written Program of Veterinary Care. Failure to have a written Program of Veterinary Care 
does not ensure the animals are receiving appropriate and adequate veterinary care which could have a negative impact 
on their health and well-being. A sampling of parasites and other pests is not being taken in accordance with a schedule 
from the attending veterinarian. A complete physical examination from head to tail of each dog is not being conducted in a 
12 month period by the attending veterinarian.  
 
Each dealer must follow an appropriate program of veterinary care for dogs that is documented in writing and signed by 
the attending veterinarian. The applicant must develop a written program of veterinary care that is signed by the attending

veterinarian in order to ensure the health and well-being of the dogs. 
 
Correct by July 30, 2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
